required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: ACOART Intracranial de Novo:DCB in the Treatment of Symptomatic Intracranial Atherosclerotic de Novo Stenosis
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multicenter, Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Intracranial Drug-coated Balloon Catheters in the Treatment of Symptomatic Intracranial Atherosclerotic de Novo Stenosis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the RCT trial is to determine whether DCB is not inferior to stent in treating intracranial de novo stenosis.

detailed_description.textblock: This trial is a prospective, multi-center, 1:1 randomized using paclitaxel coated balloon versus stent to treat intracranial stenosis of 70-99% degree. And primary endpoint is angiographic restenosis at 6 months post-procedure.

primary_outcome.measure: Angiographic restenosis of the target lesion
primary_outcome.description: angiographic restenosis measured by WASID ( Warfarin-Aspirin Symptomatic Intracranial Disease) method in core-lab

secondary_outcome.description: DCB: The balloon dilatation catheter was able to reach the treated lesion, successfully dilated without rupture, and successfully retreated. Stent: The stent enables successful arrival of the lesion and subsequent release of the stent delivery system for successful withdrawal.

secondary_outcome.measure: target vessel stroke or death event
secondary_outcome.description: Stroke (bleeding and ischemia) or death related to target vessels within 30 days postoperatively.
The incidence of recurrent ischemic stroke in the target vessel supply area 31 days to 6 months postoperatively

secondary_outcome.measure: Cerebral parenchyma hemorrhage, subarachnoid hemorrhage or intraventricular hemorrhage events
secondary_outcome.description: Any parenchymal hemorrhage, subarachnoid hemorrhage, or intraventricular hemorrhage 31 days to 6 months postoperatively
Target-vessel related death 31 days to 6 months postoperatively
transient ischemic attack event transient ischemic attack event

secondary_outcome.measure: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale score
secondary_outcome.description: National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale score at 6 months post-procedure(0-42,higher scores mean a worse outcome)
Modified Rankin Scale score at 6 months post-procedure(0-5,higher scores mean a worse outcome)

arm_group.description: use intracranial drug coated balloon catheter made by Acotec Scientific Co.,Ltd.
use the Intracranial Stent System made by MicroPort.

intervention.description: paclitaxel coated balloon catheter for intracranial PTA treatment

The Intracranial Stent System comprises of a balloon expandable stent and a delivery catheter that features a rapid exchange catheter design with a semi-compliant balloon located at its distal end.The product, APOLLO™ stent system, has the indication of endovascular treatment for intracranial stenosis approved by NMPA.
